learning_outcomes.description: Demonstrate knowledge of the regulatory framework of the income tax system in Australia.
Demonstrate an understanding of the components of the income tax equation which form the basis for determining an individual taxpayer's liability to pay income tax.
Interpret provisions of the Income Tax Assessment Acts to prepare a written argument that forms the basis of sound advice on a taxation matter.
Critically evaluate taxation judgements, Taxation Rulings and Taxation Determinations.
Discuss legal issues relating to taxation law in a confident and informed manner.

assessments.task_description:
This is a 60-minute written test conducted during class time. Further details will be provided on the Taxation Law Learn.UQ site.

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct

assessments.task_description:
The in-semester exam is based on all work completed during the semester. It is conducted during class time. It will have one practical question. It is 60 minutes in duration.

Further details will be provided on the Taxation Law Blackboard site.

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Week 11(23 Feb - 17 May)
learning_activities.topic:
Seminar

The seminar topics are:

25.2.26 Introduction and Income

4.3.26 Capital and Income

11.3.26 Income and Deductions

18.3.26 Deductions and Timing

25.3.26 Trading Stock and Capital Gains

1.4.26 Capital Gains and Tax Payable + in semester examination

15.4.26 Business + additional online activity

22.4.26 Avoidance and GST

29.4.25 FBT and Admin

6.5.25 In class In-semester Examination and feedback review

13.5.26 Emerging developments and reflection


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05
